events.name: 7 Maritime Corporates Reveal Opportunities in Singapore & Beyond
events.description:
Calling all startups!  
As part of Smart Port Challenge 2018, Jurong Port, PSA, BatamFast, Singapore Cruise Centre, Vopak, Symphony Creative Solutions (SCS) and Ocean Network Express (ONE) are looking for innovative solutions to optimise their assets and resources. PIER71 invites you to drink, play beer pong with these maritime giants and hear them out on their innovation opportunities. Come hang out with us. It will be fun, we promise! Details of innovation opportunities for Smart Port Challenge can be found at www.pier71.sg 
Register for event here: https://maritimeopportunitiesforstartups.eventbrite.sg * Drinks and light refreshments will be provided
events.location: BLOCLK71 Singapore by NUS Enterprise, #02-01, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139951

events.name: Blockchains and cryptocurrencies are tremendous .
events.description: The potential applications for Blockchains and cryptocurrencies are tremendous . The course will cover the fundamental aspects of cryptocurrencies, blockchain technologies, cryptocurrencies and applications. The topics include;-the beginning of bitcoin-advantage of altcoins-selecting different exchanges-ICOs-using e wallets-security & legal issues of cryptocurrency-mining technology-trading methodology for profitable outcome

events.name: Opportunities In Data Analytics & Data Science
events.description: Please register here, https://www.sginnovate.com/events/opportunities-data-analytics-data-science Opportunities In Data Analytics & Data Science Presented by General Assembly. Partnered with SGInnovate If you are wondering what day-to-day life as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst would be like, join us for ‘Career Conversations: Data Science & Analytics’. We will talk about various career paths, top skills needed to succeed, companies in Singapore hiring for Data roles, good places to meet other Data Scientists and Analysts, and the ups and downs of this career. Bring your questions for our panel of veteran Data Scientists and Analysts. They will give you insight into their roles, help you understand what is needed to get there, and, just maybe, inspire you to make a change. Date: 5 July 2018Time: 6:30pm- 8:15pmVenue: 32 Carpenter Street, Singapore 059911 Programme:6:30pm - 7:00pm: Check-in & Networking7:00pm - 7:45pm: Panel/Lighting Talks7:45pm - 8:15pm: Q&A and Networking Speakers:- Gayathri Venkatesan, Measurement Insights Lead, Facebook- Edoardo Venturini, Data Science Instructor , General Assembly- Melvin Perera, Data Scientist, Thomson Reuters- David Murphy, Head of TV Attribution - APAC - Google, Founder - datasaurus-rex.com Moderator:- Melanie Wu, Educations Program Producer, General Assembly

events.name: Intro to Web App Development
events.description: Come learn how to develop a simple web application using HTML, CSS and Javascript for free. Perfect for designers / startup founders / business people who want to get started in web development.
events.location: Bras Basah Complex, 231 Bain Street, #04-37, Singapore 180231

events.name: Book Club: Challenges for Game Designers
events.description: Book club returns by popular demand ;) After the previous hardcore machine learning course, we are going to switch gears to read about game design: Challenges for Game Designers, by Brenda Brathwaite. You can get the book from Amazon: https://www.amazon.com/Challenges-Game-Designers-Brenda-Brathwaite/dp/158450580X/ We are meeting weekly, covering 2 topics (about 20-40 pages) per week. Same format as previous book club meetups: - Doors open 7pm. Meetup starts 7:30pm and usually runs to 9:00/9:30pm.- Bring dinner/snacks and/or eat beforehand.- Everyone who participates is expected to read the week's chapters beforehand.- We go around the room and everybody talks about one thing you find interesting and/or ask a question regarding the chapters read. Below is a list of all the topics we plan to cover: Week 1: (DONE)The BasicsGame Design Atoms Week 2: (DONE)Puzzle DesignConverting Digital to Physical Week 3: (This week)Elements of ChanceElements of "Strategic" Skill Week 4:Elements of "Twitch" SkillChance and Skill: Finding the Balance Week 5:Targeting a MarketLearning an Unfamiliar Genre Week 6:Designing a Game to Tell a StoryAdding and Subtracting Mechanics Week 7:"But Make It Multiplayer"Creating a User Interface Week 8:Games as ArtGames as a Teaching Tool Week 9Serious GamesCasual GamesSocial Networks and Games
events.location: Tim and Wei's Residence, #06-160, 9 Boon Keng Road, Singapore

events.name: Hack && Tell Singapore - July 2018 Edition!
events.description: Hack && Tell is back for July! Call for speakers is open! Submit your proposals here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1BFOO1Q6U1V0Nns2zsFRWphHA3_3T0BimKbhdjkgBxCY--- If you've ever visited Hacker News, you've almost certainly seen the "Show HN" or "Ask HN" posts. Well, it's time to get off the Internet and tell us about it face to face. We'll provide you with our honest feedback, you provide us with a great hack, or idea. We'll give you 5 minutes to show off your tool, hack, library (did you just write a library to access the Meetup API in Go!?), whatever. We're language and software/hardware agnostic, so it's all fair game. We encourage presentations of any kind on projects that people work on for fun, for the love of all things technical. The only rules are1) no startup pitches and2) no work projects (unless it solves a general problem and is open sourced). Talk slots are 10 minutes long (*5 minutes of presentation* and 5 minutes of Q&A). First-time speakers and of underrepresented groups in tech are welcome! We'd be glad to help you prepare for your talk. --- Agenda: 6:30p - 7:00p: Dinner (will be provided)7:00p - 8:00p: Lightning Talks8:00p - 9:00p: Meet the speakers + mingling Food: Food will be provided. Vegetarian options available. Please let us know if you have any dietary or assistive needs. Location and Getting here: Zalora Singapore#[masked] Hoe Chiang RoadSingapore[masked] Nearest MRT stations: Tanjong Pagar, Outram Park Speakers and their projects: - Chua Hui Xiang: One-stop guide to all government agencies in Singapore - Wing: Raspberry Pi X telegram bot X led lights - Lim Chee Aun: Mapping 564,266 trees in Singapore 😎 - Stacy Goh: Sayleh, the feedback loop tool Submit your proposals here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1BFOO1Q6U1V0Nns2zsFRWphHA3_3T0BimKbhdjkgBxCY First time speakers are welcome!
events.location: Zalora Singapore Office, Keppel Towers , 10 Hoe Chiang Road, #18-01, 089315

events.name: How to embark on Blockchain Technology for SMEs
events.description:
How to embark on Blockchain Technology for SMEs
Embark on blockchain technology to become the next Alibaba! Equip yourselves with the knowledge and technology that will propel your business to the next level.
Blockchain has helped many companies in making their management systems and logistics run smoother, faster, safer and less expensive, besides ensuring data security. But how do we execute that? That is the question on the minds of many business owners. 
That is where we come in. PLMP Fintech has set up a training course to help SMEs and startups grow their businesses utilizing blockchain solutions. This course will give you invaluable insights and knowledge on how to leverage blockchain technology to solve the problems your business is facing.
events.location: PLMP FinTech, 23 Serangoon North Ave 5, #05-01, Level 5, PLMP Training Room, Singapore 554530

events.name: Campus Party SG- TO INFINITY and BEYOND!-  With IoT, ARVR, AI, ML, Robotics
events.description: IoTSG is super excited to partner with first ever Asian edition of Campus Party in Singapore. (http://singapore.campus-party.org/) Campus party is one of the biggest tech festivals in the world focusing on ideas, innovation, creation, & collaboration. Many esteemed experts (Steve Wozniak, Tim Berners Lee, Stephen Hawking to name a few) have spoken at different editions and locations in world. You can see it in global website: http://www.campus-party.org/ IoTSG will focus on great work and innovation in IoT/AI/AR-VR/Robotics, and we are inviting experts and change makers in these domains. To speak and to showcase their work, solutions, use cases and journey in technology to inspire other young professionals. DONOT MISS- This is happening first time in Singapore/Asia, and you will meet many cross vertical experts, makers, doers from different parts of the world! You can see the current list of speakers here: http://singapore.campus-party.org/program/presenters/ ********************************************************************All Access Passes (Single Day and 3 Day) available for purchase at 30% discounted rate for all IoTSG members when you quote“IoTSG30”. Tickets are available at: http://singapore.campusparty.org/attend/ Agenda: https://lnkd.in/gcN56F6Presenters: https://lnkd.in/g2ifdwv******************************************************************** From IoTSG Ecosystem we have following speakers (more to be added): Dr Bhaskaran Mani, Associate Prof, SERI, NTUSaral Tayal- Maker & Tinkerer & CEO, Tinker-Spark ********************************************************************All Access Passes (Single Day and 3 Day) available for purchase at 30% discounted rate for all IoTSG members when you quote“IoTSG30”. Tickets are available at: http://singapore.campusparty.org/attend/********************************************************************
